content.headline: Developmental Milestones: Tracking Your Child's Growth from 2-5 Years
content.intro: Understanding developmental milestones helps parents track their child's progress and identify areas where they might need additional support.

sections.title: Key Developmental Domains Explained
sections.content: Child development occurs across four main areas:
points: Physical Development: Gross and fine motor skills, coordination
Personal/Social Development: Emotional regulation, social interactions

sections.title: Developmental Milestones by Age
sections.content: Here's what to expect at each stage from ages 2-5:
points: Age 2: Kicks ball, walks stairs, plays alongside others, 2-4 word sentences
Age 3: Climbs and runs, pedals tricycle, takes turns, expresses emotions
Age 4: Catches balls, uses scissors, prefers social play, knows songs
Age 5: Hops and swings, uses utensils, speaks clearly, counts to 10

sections.title: Supporting Healthy Development
sections.content: You can actively support your child's development:
points: Provide plenty of opportunities for physical play and exploration
Encourage social interactions with peers through playdates
Read together daily to build language and cognitive skills
Offer age-appropriate puzzles and games that challenge thinking
Create consistent routines that provide security and predictability
